title: Philosophical Concepts
description: Challenge yourself with fundamental ideas that have shaped human thought

questions.question: The philosophical thought experiment 'Plato's Cave' illustrates what concept?
options: The nature of reality vs. perception

questions.question: What does 'nihilism' generally assert?
options: Nature is the source of all truth
Life is inherently without objective meaning

questions.question: The 'categorical imperative' is a central concept of which philosopher?
'Cogito, ergo sum' (I think, therefore I am) addresses what philosophical problem?
What is 'empiricism'?
options: The belief that reason alone leads to knowledge
The belief that knowledge comes primarily from sensory experience

questions.question: The 'social contract' theory was developed by Hobbes, Locke, and which other philosopher?
What branch of philosophy deals with questions of right and wrong?
What is 'determinism'?
options: The study of fate in mythology
The belief that free will is the highest good
The belief that all events are caused by prior events and conditions

questions.question: The 'trolley problem' is a famous thought experiment in which area of philosophy?
What is 'dualism' in philosophy of mind?
options: The belief that only physical matter exists
The view that mind and body are two distinct substances
The idea that truth is relative

questions.question: 'Occam's Razor' suggests that the best explanation is usually the one that is what?
What does 'aesthetics' study?
options: The nature of beauty and art
